Looks good to me thanks for contributing this !
Thanks for the contribution!

Hello, thank you for your contribution. I'll have to review it in more details, but I looked at it quickly and have a question. 

I noticed you re-introduce the CXF logging. This was removed because of issues with JDK 11. Which JDK did you test this with ?

Regards,
  Serge...

Hello, I was also working on OpenAPI support on my side. 

Here are the changes I did:

[UNOMI-____Swagger_&_OpenAPI_integration.patch.txt](https://github.com/apache/unomi/files/4386672/UNOMI-____Swagger_._OpenAPI_integration.patch.txt)

Maybe we could somehow merge these two approaches?

@sergehuber I would prefer to add the swagger feature in your patch, we could be have the both features. However I don't know if it make sense to have the both features, may be only OpenAPI is enough.

That would be great to merge at your end
[swagger.txt](https://github.com/apache/unomi/files/4393582/swagger.txt)

Hello,

Thank you for your contribution, but I found a few issues with it. 

1. Please do the PR against the GraphQL branch and not the master, this way this will avoid having the comparison between the branches
2. Please add a minimal description to the PR, or at least update the ticket
3. I would have preferred that we avoid integrating the Javascript directly but instead using the frontend-maven-plugin to setup the project and have the Javascript pull directly from NPM. You can find more information about this plugin here: https://github.com/eirslett/frontend-maven-plugin

Best regards,
  Serge Huber.

Hey @sergehuber & @jbonofre,
I added some itests, can u please take a look and see if this is what u had in mind? if there are more use cases u wish to test let me know and ill add them...
Testing this stuff is quite tiresome as most of the underlying processes are async which forces the tests to wait for them.
anyhow, if there is another place u wish to document this let me know,
Much appreciated,
Ron

Hello Ron, 

Thanks for all this, I'll look at it asap.

Regards,
  Serge...

I just had a quick look at the code and it looks good, I'll want to test it before merging it. 

We also talk about documenting the feature and explaining it, will you contribute this separately (you could for example add content to the manual) ?

Hey @sergehuber, 
No problems I'll add it to the manual in this pr,
10x
Ron

Hey @sergehuber,
Added a new doc to the manual, let me know what u think,
10x
Ron

Thanks for the changes, I would still like to integrate the frontend-maven-plugin to avoid copying all the Javascript files into the project. Are you familiar with it ? You can simply use a package.json file at the root of your project and then have it executed like this:

            <plugin>
                <groupId>com.github.eirslett</groupId>
                <artifactId>frontend-maven-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>1.8.0</version>
                <executions>
                    <execution>
                        <id>npm install node and yarn</id>
                        <phase>generate-resources</phase>
                        <goals>
                            <goal>install-node-and-yarn</goal>
                        </goals>
                        <configuration>
                            <nodeVersion>v11.11.0</nodeVersion>
                            <yarnVersion>v1.19.1</yarnVersion>
                        </configuration>
                    </execution>
                    <execution>
                        <id>yarn install</id>
                        <phase>generate-resources</phase>
                        <goals>
                            <goal>yarn</goal>
                        </goals>
                    </execution>
                    <execution>
                        <id>yarn post-install</id>
                        <phase>generate-resources</phase>
                        <goals>
                            <goal>yarn</goal>
                        </goals>
                        <configuration>
                            <arguments>${yarn.arguments}</arguments>
                        </configuration>
                    </execution>
                </executions>
            </plugin>

This way you could use yarn add graphql-playground-react and set it up as needed. What do you think ? 

Also did you see that GraphQL Playground and GraphiQL will be merging. It doesn't change anything right now but it might be something we want to stay on top of.
I also forgot to mention that you copied a lot of files from another modules that don't seem useful (like blueprint.xml) and it would be best to get rid of them.
Can I close this PR ?
Can I close this PR ?
Closed as is duplicated in PR#144
Closed as is duplicated in PR#144

@sergehuber Thank you!! and I'm not worried :)
1.5.0 is coming out soon?

@RonBarabash given the size of the contribution I think it would be best if you sign a CLA. You can find the information here: https://www.apache.org/licenses/contributor-agreements.html 

This only needs to be done once, and if you did it for another project it's not needed. Just make sure you put "Unomi" in the project name and let me know when it's done.

Thanks a lot !

I couldn't create issue to report my own idea. Sorry for asking you in this thread!

I figured out we save event before broadcast to Rule Engine.
What if we have an Action which need to modify event before persist to ElasticSearch?
That would be great to move [this line](https://github.com/apache/unomi/blob/918a3239f6b3a070b80b331be6d262b740b70cef/services/src/main/java/org/apache/unomi/services/impl/events/EventServiceImpl.java#L155) to the end of function 
What do you think about it?

And also if you could add a section to the manual that would be fantastic !

Hopefully last commit solve your request! Thanks for your prompt review

Thank you for the PR !

Hey Serge, sorry for the late response.
I added a Jira ticket for this PR. As for your comment about using the bundleContext.close(), I fixed it (didn't pushed yet), but I think that since other threads are running while the system bundle context is closed, there are errors and the application is not gracefully shutting down. For example, I get this error - 
```
org.ops4j.pax.web.pax-web-extender-war [org.ops4j.pax.web.extender.war.internal.WebObserver] ERROR : Error scanning web bundle org.apache.unomi.wab [162]: null
java.lang.NullPointerException
```
and other errors as well, depends on the specific run.
Probably because other threads are running and the bundles were already closed.
Do you have any suggestions how to handle that?
Thanks

@sergehuber I'm thinking that maybe to make this a more robust change we need to get the PersistenceService to return the new saved object whenever a save is triggered (changing the signature for all the save functions), WDYT?
